$spy The thing about the New WS Quant driven model is they dont get out & check the ground level.  
 
$DLTR are not cheaper same with $DG. You save on a few things & balloons are the best seller re: Margins but w/ the Algos & sentiment things can move higher fast but you have to watch for the fast drop. 
 
Just like $aapl & tech WS always follows each other & never lead, then when things shift they all run away. 
 
$xrt
$AAPL Very Bullish on Monday morning. Expecting to see Apple pop open 168-169

@billbraski1777 @Sarge_slaughter  
 
Gotcha. Either way, compared to a lot of tech we have been hammered worse than I thought.  
 
$MSFT, $AAPL, even $NVDA all sitting with much higher forward p/e. Our P/E is still high, but should adjust quickly.  
 
Goofy.

$AAPL $TSM $NVDA $SOXL $AMD 
The Taiwanese manufacturer said it has suspended production to comply with Shanghai’s Covid-19 control measures, which have severely squeezed supply chains

Quanta is known for producing MacBook Pros, which could contribute further to Apple shortages after Pegatron Corporation stopped making electronics for brands
https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3174252/macbook-manufacturer-quanta-computer-halts-production-shanghai

links.title: MacBook supplies at risk after Quanta Computer halts production in Shanghai
links.description: The Taiwanese manufacturer said it has suspended production to comply with Shanghai's Covid-19 control measures, which have severely squeezed supply chains.

Its just a consequence to endless fed money printing..... there's always a consequence... nothing ever goes up infinitely.

$AAPL Apple will reportedly use LG Innotek and Jahwa for the iPhone 15’s periscope lens
 https://flip.it/SXdJH_

links.title: Apple will reportedly use LG Innotek and Jahwa for the iPhone 15's periscope lens
links.description: Apple will use its long-time camera module supplier LG Innotek and parts maker Jahwa Electronics for its folded zoom camera modules. This technology makes for a periscope-like lens on the iPhone with a smaller camera bump. As we previously reported, Jahwa is spending 191 billion won on new facilities, hinting at a potential partnership with Apple.

@TechniTraderEducation This is a normal Trading Range pattern for $AAPL and it has quite a few more points to run down before it starts the upward runs within the range again. Many big tech stocks will remain range bound as temporarily inflated revenues during the pandemic are patterned out.

links.title: China's Tech Leaders Warn Of Widespread Production Halt If Shanghai Lockdown Continues
links.description: Two of China's prominent technology executives have spoken out about the widespread supply chain disruptions caused by the lockdown in Shanghai, warning that many of the country's industries are facing the prospect of production halts in May if the situation persists.

body: @rickohshay @AdamPwC yes but with Shanghai factories significantly increasing output this coming Monday April 18th, and after a down week last week, we should see big green price jumps on Monday in both $AAPL and Tesla.

links.title: 'We are making progress': Top Democrat on student loan forgiveness
links.description: A top Democratic lawmaker said that progress was being made to push the White House to cancel student loan debt. "I have told the president, this is one of the most important things he can do to help our economy grow," Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) said at the 'The State of Student Debt Summit.'

I would think that $AAPL could see the same re-start... 
 
https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/tesla-looks-resume-production-shanghai-plant-april-18-sources-2022-04-15/

links.title: Tesla looks to resume production at Shanghai plant on April 18 -sources
links.description: SHANGHAI, April 15 (Reuters) - Tesla (TSLA.O) is preparing to resume production at its Shanghai plant on Monday following a three-week stoppage, having received the go-ahead from local authorities, two people familiar with the matter said.
